title: Man arrested in France mosque attack
text:
An 84-year-old French man shot two people and attempted to set fire to the door of a mosque in the town of Bayonne on Monday, according to ABC News.

The suspect, Claude Sinke, set fire to a vehicle as he left the scene and shot two men, aged 74 and 78, as he attempted to set the door on fire. Their wounds were described as “serious.”

Sinke, who was arrested at his home in the Landes region, was a candidate for the far-right National Rally in 2015 but has since left the movement, according to ABC.

"I strongly condemn the heinous attack perpetrated in front of the Bayonne mosque," French President Emmanuel Macron Emmanuel Jean-Michel MacronMacron urges EU to condemn Turkish invasion of Syria US should support, but also prod, Ukraine Civil liberties groups sound alarm over online extremism bill MORE said in a tweet. "I address my thoughts to the victims. The Republic will never tolerate hatred. Everything will be done to punish the perpetrators and protect our compatriots of the Muslim faith. I commit myself to it."

Je condamne avec fermeté l’attaque odieuse perpétrée devant la mosquée de Bayonne. J'adresse mes pensées aux victimes. La République ne tolérera jamais la haine. Tout sera mis en œuvre pour punir les auteurs et protéger nos compatriotes de confession musulmane. Je m’y engage. — Emmanuel Macron (@EmmanuelMacron) October 28, 2019

French Interior Minister Christophe Castaner also tweeted in response to the incident to convey his "solidarity and support to the Muslim community."

Les faits commis à la mosquée de #Bayonne émeuvent et indignent chacun d’entre nous.

Mes premières pensées vont aux blessés et à leurs proches.

Solidarité et soutien à la communauté musulmane dont je mesure le choc et l’effroi. — Christophe Castaner (@CCastaner) October 28, 2019

National Rally President Marine Le Pen also condemned the incident, calling it “an unspeakable act” that “must be treated with the utmost severity.”
